tagged_story_for_tts:
<[silence:3400]>
"Lonely wanderers. Planets without suns."

<[silence:2400]>
The name "rogue planet" fits because they drift alone, untethered to any star.<[silence:1200]>

<[silence:2400]>
Most planets orbit stars, like Earth circles the Sun.<[silence:1200]>
Rogue planets don’t.<[silence:1200]>
They float freely in the dark, ejected from their birth systems or born in isolation.<[silence:2400]>
Some are gas giants, like Jupiter.<[silence:1200]>
Others are icy or rocky, drifting silently.<[silence:2400]>
One, named SIMP J01365663+0933473, glows faintly with its own heat—12 times Jupiter’s mass, yet starless.<[silence:2400]>
Scientists estimate trillions could exist in our galaxy alone.<[silence:1200]>
No sunlight warms them.<[silence:1200]>
No seasons mark their years.<[silence:2400]>
They’re cosmic orphans, moving unseen through the void.<[silence:1200]>

<[silence:2400]>
Nomadic worlds.<[silence:1200]>
Frozen time.<[silence:1200]>
The unseen majority.
clean_story:
<[silence:3400]>
"Lonely wanderers. Planets without suns. "

<[silence:2400]>
The name "rogue planet" fits because they drift alone, untethered to any star. <[silence:2400]>
Most planets orbit stars, like Earth circles the Sun. Rogue planets don’t. They float freely in the dark, ejected from their birth systems or born in isolation. <[silence:2400]>
Some are gas giants, like Jupiter. Others are icy or rocky, drifting silently. <[silence:2400]>
One, named SIMP J01365663+0933473, glows faintly with its own heat—12 times Jupiter’s mass, yet starless. <[silence:2400]>
Scientists estimate trillions could exist in our galaxy alone. No sunlight warms them. No seasons mark their years. <[silence:2400]>
They’re cosmic orphans, moving unseen through the void. <[silence:2400]>
Nomadic worlds. Frozen time. The unseen majority.
